doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Finds PEST motifs as potential proteolytic cleavage sites

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Protein sequence USA to be analysed.

xhtml:div.label:
Window length (value greater than or equal to 2)?
Minimal distance between positively charged amino acids.

Sort order of results?
Length Position Score
Name of the output file which holds the results of the analysis. Results may be sorted by length, position and score.

Threshold score (value from -55.0 to +55.0)?
Threshold value to discriminate weak from potential PEST motifs. Valid PEST motifs are discriminated into 'poor' and 'potential' motifs depending on this threshold score. By default, the default value is set to +5.0 based on experimental data. Alterations are not recommended since significance is a matter of biology, not mathematics.
Use monoisotopic weights Yes No

Display potential pest motifs?
Yes No
Decide whether potential PEST motifs should be printed.

Display poor pest motifs?
Yes No
Decide whether poor PEST motifs should be printed.

Display invalid pest motifs?
Yes No
Decide whether invalid PEST motifs should be printed.

Display pest motifs map?
Yes No
Decide whether PEST motifs should be mapped to sequence.

Name of the output file (e_outfile)?
Name of file to which results will be written.
Choose the e_graph output format Png Gif Cps Ps Meta Data
Name of the output graph

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Protein sequence USA to be analysed.
Minimal distance between positively charged amino acids.
Name of the output file which holds the results of the analysis. Results may be sorted by length, position and score.

Threshold value to discriminate weak from potential PEST motifs. Valid PEST motifs are discriminated into 'poor' and 'potential' motifs depending on this threshold score. By default, the default value is set to +5.0 based on experimental data. Alterations are not recommended since significance is a matter of biology, not mathematics.
Decide whether potential PEST motifs should be printed.
Decide whether poor PEST motifs should be printed.
Decide whether invalid PEST motifs should be printed.
Decide whether PEST motifs should be mapped to sequence.
Name of file to which results will be written.

parameter.name: e_window
parameter.prompt: Window length (value greater than or equal to 2)

format.code: ("", " -window=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 2 is required

comment.text: Minimal distance between positively charged amino acids.

interface.label:
Window length (value greater than or equal to 2)?
Minimal distance between positively charged amino acids.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Minimal distance between positively charged amino acids.

format.code: ("", " -order=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: Name of the output file which holds the results of the analysis. Results may be sorted by length, position and score.

interface.label:
Sort order of results?
Length Position Score
Name of the output file which holds the results of the analysis. Results may be sorted by length, position and score.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Name of the output file which holds the results of the analysis. Results may be sorted by length, position and score.

format.code: ("", " -threshold=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to -55.0 is required
Value less than or equal to +55.0 is required

comment.text: Threshold value to discriminate weak from potential PEST motifs. Valid PEST motifs are discriminated into 'poor' and 'potential' motifs depending on this threshold score. By default, the default value is set to +5.0 based on experimental data. Alterations are not recommended since significance is a matter of biology, not mathematics.

interface.label:
Threshold score (value from -55.0 to +55.0)?
Threshold value to discriminate weak from potential PEST motifs. Valid PEST motifs are discriminated into 'poor' and 'potential' motifs depending on this threshold score. By default, the default value is set to +5.0 based on experimental data. Alterations are not recommended since significance is a matter of biology, not mathematics.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Threshold value to discriminate weak from potential PEST motifs. Valid PEST motifs are discriminated into 'poor' and 'potential' motifs depending on this threshold score. By default, the default value is set to +5.0 based on experimental data. Alterations are not recommended since significance is a matter of biology, not mathematics.
